body: Note: tried to add test to verify this but it's a bit difficult, because the tests are based on mock zookeeper and here the reconnection logic is already embedded in the ZK client instance itself.
Would be nice to have some tests of the cli part, since that is user facing

@rdhabalia thanks for working on this.  This is an awesome feature!  Just a overall comments:

This is a very large PR.  Perhaps we can break this up into multiple PRs to make reviewing easier?

Also, we are working on a connector framework for Pulsar that will run on top of functions:

https://github.com/apache/incubator-pulsar/tree/master/pulsar-connect/core/src/main/java/org/apache/pulsar/connect/core

I working on running the connectors on top of functions.  Perhaps the replicator framework can use the connector framework as well so we don't duplicate efforts

> This is a very large PR. Perhaps we can break this up into multiple PRs to make reviewing easier?

actually, kinesis provider code is relatively very small but it adds more context with replicator framework interface so, I kept it together. I am going to add stats-api, non-persistent topic support, auto-registration in separate PRs for better review.

> Perhaps the replicator framework can use the connector framework as well so we don't duplicate efforts

Sure. In Yahoo, we need exactly like a replicator framework with which we can get granular control for operability and right now, immediately we need it for kinesis. So, we can definitely enhance replicator with other connector usecases.

I'm loving Pulsar's design. I came here to suggest offloading data into object storage so that the client would not even notice and you are already working on it. Thank you!

Food for thought: It is the Pulsar client's responsibility to compress and decompress messages. However, I wonder if for some use cases it might make sense to store only compressed data in the object storage while within the cluster the data would stay in decompressed form. I would find it simpler if in most cases the client would not need to worry about storage yet the cluster admins could use storage space efficiently.

Do you think it makes sense to include compression in the scope of tiered storage? Or is this an object storage implementation issue that should be handled by Minio, for example?

For reference, xz compresses our most voluminous JSON events into 5 % of the original size.
retest this please //  BatchMessageTest.testSmallReceiverQueueBuild timed out (after 200 minutes) c++ tests
@ivankelly @sijie Would you please help on review it? Thanks.

> Would be nice to have some tests of the cli part, since that is user facing

Good point. I'll add that
I don't have the bandwidth to figure out why the tests are failing at the moment, so I'm going to close this for now and re-open later (in the interest of clearing out noise in the backlog).

I'd also recommend using `Optional` instead of allowing for `null` on methods like `getValue`. `CompletableFuture<Optional<ByteBuffer>>` is admittedly somewhat verbose but it does have the virtue of preventing a lot of `null`-related headaches.

@sijie @merlimat I've updated the offloading to be two phase, it updates the metadata, offloads, then marks the operation as complete. Will you check the changes, and if they're good, I'll push the interface update as a separate PR (I need to update the javadoc for that too)
@ivankelly the interface looks good to me. will take a look at the details.

@haphut Are you suggesting that the offloading implementation compresses the data as it's sent to the long term storage, regardless of whether the topic is compressed or not? This seems like something that should be pretty easy to do with how we're building tiered storage. It likely won't make it into the first cut, but as I said, should be pretty easy to add to second iteration.
Yes, that's what I mean. Good to hear that you do not see major obstacles for adding it later. Keep up the great work!
@sijie will wait until you've checked the impl before pushing the interface changes, in case they have to change again
@srkukarni @lucperkins thank you for your reviews and will incorporate your comments.

This issue of pulsar-client-admin  should be fixed by #1370 and it will be released in the upcoming 2.0.0 release. It should be coming out in this month.

Similar issue happens if you create a subscription via bin/pulsar-admin or HTTP REST PUT method.

@sijie commented:
> I think the different is admin.createSubscription is using http protocol, which I think each createSubscription is creating a new connection and close it. (If I remember correctly, http/1.0 doesnt support multiplexing). while create consumer/close is binary protocol over tcp connection, so connection is multiplexed for different commands.

I would think some features like creating a subscription should be moved to PulsarClient for faster performance with binary protobuf protocol.

At the same time @merlimat noted:
> The multiple requests should be using HTTP/1.1 with Keep-Alive
Anyway creating 1000 subscriptions during even in ~7 seconds is still a slow performance. It should be much faster.
Currently I can't reproduce the failure of PersistentFailoverE2ETest, trying to adding more logging information and see if CI can give more context about this bug.

The problem was reproducing for me locally when running multiple times, with 

```java
@Test(invocationCount=100)
...
```

Failed typically within ~20 executions

yup, in progress.

two issues spots with this integration tests:

- pulsar admin doesn't handle exception correctly. 
```
Got exception: javax.ws.rs.RedirectionException cannot be cast to javax.ws.rs.ClientErrorException
```
- pulsar admin doesn't handle redirects at all..
Talked with @jerrypeng  I think this is fixed. closing it.

It worked great! 
Thank you Matteo
I can create an events page
Oh whoops, looks like that was already taken care of

@srkukarni @merlimat 
As per discussion, we want pulsar replicator to use pulsar-connector to replicate messages to external systems. It seems [ReplicatorProducer-API](https://github.com/rdhabalia/pulsar/blob/2c9e499af0a685ef2dbeac01fbaa738040212788/pulsar-replicator/providers/provider/src/main/java/org/apache/pulsar/replicator/api/ReplicatorProducer.java) in replicator framework is similar as [Sink-API](https://github.com/apache/incubator-pulsar/blob/master/pulsar-connect/core/src/main/java/org/apache/pulsar/connect/core/Sink.java) so, we will not require any significant change for Sink api and replicator should be using it with small changes in it.
Right now, Sink API accepts different [Message](https://github.com/apache/incubator-pulsar/blob/master/pulsar-connect/core/src/main/java/org/apache/pulsar/connect/core/Message.java) type than pulsar [Message](https://github.com/apache/incubator-pulsar/blob/master/pulsar-client/src/main/java/org/apache/pulsar/client/api/Message.java) which requires replicator to create additional unnecessary object. So, I created PR-#1632 to use Pulsar-message in Sink api.

Pulsar replicator implementation mainly touches 3 things:
1. Onboarding api
2. Replicator function that initializes connectors
3. pulsar connector that actually publish messages to external system.

#1594 covers all above functionalities. so, once pulsar-connector [PR]() is merged, I will rebase replicator-PR on top of it and later in separate PR, we can merge replicator and connector in one module.

Can you please let us know your thoughts.?

@lucperkins As I wrote on my last comment, we have an event page but we haven't passed the check because the check is a bit strict. It would be great if you could add a link for ApacheCon page with the logo. Then we probably be able to dodge the check.

Just realized that the parameter in the body should not be `{"actions": ["consume", "produce"]}` it should be `[0, 1]`. But still the documentation is missing the actions parameter and what a correctly formated JSON should look like. Potentially other REST interfaces also take body params that are missing from the documentation.

@merlimat, Do you have any thoughts on this?
Thanks!
